info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:04PM EDT until June 16 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL LOUDOUN...EAST CENTRAL CLARKE AND SOUTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 404 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bluemont, or 8 miles south of Charles Town, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Purcellville, Round Hill, Bluemont, Hamilton, Wickliffe, Paeonian Springs, Philomont, Lincoln, Hughesville and Rippon. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
